decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from approved application P/2023/3969 dated 23/04/2024.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The single storey academy building hereby permitted shall be for a limited period, being the period of 5 years from the date of this decision. The building hereby permitted shall be removed and the land restored to its former condition on or before 5 years of the date of this decision in accordance with a scheme of work that shall first have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: The proposal is not considered suitable as a permanent form of development to safeguard neighbours' living conditions and the character and appearance of the area.

Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: (23051 001 P1, 23051 064-2 P1, 23051 064-3 P1, 23051 070 P1, 23051 120 P25, 23051 221 P25, 23051 225 P25, 5887 / 004 B, 5887 / 204 B, L030-P-1310, Planning Statement, Design & Access Statement, Heritage, Townscape and Visual Impact Assessment, Brentford Football Club Site Alternative Assessment Report 2nd Version, Ecological Impact Assessment, Transport Assessment, Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy: Brentford FC Training Ground (Academy Building, Ground Maintenance Area and Car Park), Flood Risk Assessment & Drainage Strategy Brentford FC Cat 1 Academy - Pitches, Air Quality Assessment, The Need for a Category 1 Academy, its Requirements and Operation and Community Use, Operational Waste Management Plan, Statement of Community Involvement, Outline Landscape Specification, Landscape Statement, Lighting Assessment, Cover Letter. Received 19 December 2023; Fire Statement. Received 2 January 2024; Memorandum of Understanding between Brentford FC United, Brentford FC Community Sports Trust, and Heston Community School. Received 22 January 2024; Acoustic Impact Assessment. Received 30 January 2024; 23051 100 P28, 23051 101 P28, 23051 200 P28, 23051 201 P28, 23051 205 P28, L030-P-1208 A , Landscape Statement Addendum, Phase 1 Preliminary Risk Assessment, Site Investigation & Ground Assessment, Letter from Greengage dated 9 February 2024, BREEAM Pre-Assessment, Irrigation rainwater harvesting response, Testing of Soils Onsite over Football Pitches, Site Alternative Assessment Update, Precedent Images of Other London Training Centres and Academies, Transport Note dated 7 February 2024, The Need for a Category 1 Academy, its Requirements And Operation And Community Use Addendum, Design & Access Statement Addendum. Received 9 February 2024; Landscape Maintenance and Management Schedule. Received 13 February 2024.; BFC's response to the questions r

Condition : 4 - The use of hereby approved premises shall be limited to Monday to Sunday between the hours of 07:00 and 22:30.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions.

Condition : 5 - The floodlighting hereby permitted shall only be operated between dawn and 21:00 every day of the week.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the character of the locality.

Condition : 6 - The access doorway to the temporary academy building, grounds maintenance building and indoor covered pitch shall have: a minimum clear width of 900mm; a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor not exceeding a gradient of 1:12; a door handle set no more than one metre above ground level and a 400 mm high steel 'kick plate' suitable for the needs of wheelchair users or shall be automatic opening. In cases where the door has no frame and is part of a fully glazed frontage, the door and glazed frontage hereby approved shall be clearly defined with visual manifestations on the glass at two levels: between 850mm to 1000mm and 1400mm to 1600mm above ground level.
The manifestations shall be fixed to, painted on or etched into the glass in the form of a continuous or broken (by no more than 20 mm) horizontal band 50 mm high, or a series of signs or logos at least 150mm high spaced no further than 300 mm apart. The manifestations shall visually contrast with their surroundings when viewed from both inside and outside the building in all lighting conditions
Reason: In order to ensure that the development complies with inclusive design principles.

Condition : 7 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development hereby approved shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance (SPG) 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014, or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.
Reason: In the interests of air quality and to protect neighbours' living conditions and the wider local environment.

Condition : 8 - The cumulative measured or calculated Rating Level of noise emitted from all mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) shall be 5dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 metre from the faï¿½ade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance with the latest revision of British Standard 4142.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions.

Condition : 9 - No playing of musical instruments or operation of sound amplification equipment shall occur in association with the use of the proposed development.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the hereby approved Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP).
Reason: In the interests of air quality and to protect neighbours' living conditions and the wider local environment.

Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Delivery & Servicing Plan hereby approved shall be fully implemented and maintained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: In the interests of the safety of pedestrians and vehicles, to protect neighbours' living conditions and to support sustainable transport objectives and road safety.

Condition : 12 - The landscaping details shown on the submitted plans and documents shall be carried out as approved.
The works shall comply with the requirements specified in BS 3936 (1992) 'Specification of Nursery Stock Part 1 Trees and Shrubs', and in BS 4428 (1989) 'Recommendations for General Landscape Operations'.
All landscaping comprised in the approved details shall be carried out during the first planting and seeding seasons following completion of construction works or first occupation. Any trees or shrubs planted (including any such replacements) which die within five years from the date of planting shall be replaced in the next planting season with the same species, and of comparable maturity. The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approval.
Reason: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and the area.

Condition : 13 - The development should be carried out in accordance with the hereby approved Ecological Management Plan and the mitigation measures identified shall be carried out for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: In the interest of biodiversity, sustainability, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.

Condition : 14 - Before occupation of the each phase of development, a post construction monitoring report shall be completed in line with the Greater London Authority's (GLA) Circular Economy Statement Guidance published at the time of submission. The postconstruction monitoring report shall be submitted to the GLA for approval, via email at: circulareconomystatements@london.gov.uk, along with any supporting evidence as per the guidance. Confirmation of submission to the GLA shall be submitted to the local planning authority simultaneously together with a copy of the documents submitted.
Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials

Condition : 15 - Before the first occupation of each phase of the development, the postconstruction tab of the Greater London Authority's (GLA) Whole Life-Cycle Carbon Assessment template shall be completed in line with the GLA's Whole Life-Cycle Carbon Assessment Guidance published at the time of submission. The post-construction assessment shall be submitted to the GLA for approval at: ZeroCarbonPlanning@london.gov.uk, along with any supporting evidence as per the guidance. Confirmation of submission to the GLA shall be submitted to the local planning authority simultaneously together with a copy of the documents submitted.
Reason: In the interests of sustainable development and to maximise on-site carbon dioxide saving.

Condition : 16 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities that accord with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (for not less than 20 bicycles including a minimum of 5% of spaces being made available for larger and adaptable cycles) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the development is first occupied or brought into use, The approved facilities shall be thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 17 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a finalised academy Travel Plan in accordance with current Council and TfL guidance comprising immediate, continuing and long-term measures to promote and encourage a reduction in car use shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented upon occupation, and thereafter monitored and reviewed in accordance with the agreed Travel Plan targets and timescales to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives, including a reduction in single occupancy car journeys and the increased use of public transport, walking and cycling.

Condition : 18 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Car Parking Management Plan, to cover the whole use of the site and to include appropriate commitments for a reduction in parking subject to monitoring, shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Reason: To control the level and usage of parking on the site and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 19 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of a minimum output of 7.2kW, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards. Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, with photographic evidence submitted to the Local Planning Authority upon completion, and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Reason: In order to promote sustainable modes of transport.

Condition : 20 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Reason: In order to ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed.

Condition : 21 - The development should be carried out in accordance with the hereby approved Phase 1 Preliminary Risk Assessment (Ref. BEK-23151-1, dated Dec 2023) and Site Investigation & Ground Assessment Report (Ref. BEK-23151-2, dated Jan 2024).
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.

Condition : 22 - Land quality - additional/unexpected contamination found during development
During the development:
The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if any land contamination not previously identified is encountered during development. A competent person shall assess the contamination, where necessary, including soil and groundwater sampling and testing before any further part of the development that may be affected by the additional contamination that has been discovered continues.
A remediation method statement, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval within one month of the discovery of such contamination.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i) Further remediation work to remove or manage additional contamination shall be carried out in accordance with the approved revised remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use.
(ii) In some instances, the local planning authority may require work on site to be ceased whilst the nature of additional contamination is investigated fully.
(iii) The Council requests that the revised remediation method statement or any site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 23 - Land quality - verification and validation of remedial work
Before the development is first brought into use:
The scheme for remediation approved under Condition 24, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented. A verification report produced upon completion of the remediation by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval, before the development is first brought into use or in accordance with a programme approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i) The verification (closure) report shall revisit the conceptual site model and provide evidence that each aspect of the remediation plan has been implemented correctly and successfully in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice. Where applicable, the report shall describe how any additional/unexpected contamination encountered during development has been managed in line with the revised remediation method statement.
(ii) This report shall demonstrate that the development is suitable for its proposed use in terms of land quality.
(iii) The Council requests that the verification report or site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 24 - Land quality - long term monitoring and maintenance
If long term monitoring and maintenance is required following successful completion of approved remedial measures, reports which demonstrate the effectiveness of the monitoring and maintenance shall be prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person and submitted to the local planning authority according to an agreed timescale as shall first have been approved under other conditions set out in this planning approval decision notice.
This shall be conducted in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice.
Reason: In order to ensure that risks from land contamination to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised, together with those to controlled waters, properties and ecological systems.

Condition : 25 - The hereby approved development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of the proposed fencing along Alderney Avenue approved under application reference P/2024/2273 dated 	09 September 2024. 
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the character and appearance of the area.

Condition : 26 - The hereby approved development shall be carried out in accordance with the details on the commitments for providing taxi credits to site users approved under application reference P/2024/2370 dated 09 September 2024. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 27 - The overspill parking area shall only be used in accordance with details to be set out in a Car Parking Management Plan, and shall not be used for parking associated with the Academy use.
Reason: In order to control the level and usage of parking on the site and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 28 - The development must be implemented in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Statement prepared by AW Fire dated 14 December 2023
Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

Condition : 29 - The development must be carried out in accordance with the car parking arrangements set out in Plan Ref: 23051 068 P6 and shall not exceed 85 spaces for the academy car park and 30 spaces for the overspill car parking.
Reason: To ensure the development does not over-provide car parking on site and encourages mode shift towards active and sustainable travel modes, in line with London Plan Policy T1.
description: Variation of Condition 3 (Approved Plans) and the Removal of Condition 14 (BREEAM) and Condition 31 (Car Park Layout) to facilitate changes to the grounds' maintenance building, car park and pathways, landscaping, and fencing of planning permission P/2023/3969 approved 23/04/2024 for the erection of a permanent indoor football pitch, single storey grounds' maintenance building, artificial pitch with fencing, floodlighting, lattice CCTV masts and additional playing pitches with car parking, access roads and paths, hard and soft landscaping and a temporary single storey football academy building and associated gym (for five years)
